Šarec: Ne zapušča vlada Levice, prej obratno
06 Nov 2019, 17:18 by STA

Premier Marjan Šarec je prepričan, da ni vlada tista, ki bi zapuščala Levico, ampak je lahko prej obratno. Še preden je koordinator Levice Luka Mesec sporočil, da zanje sporazum o sodelovanju s koalicijo ni več obvezujoč, je Šarec v izjavi ponovil, da si želi nadaljnjega sodelovanja. Vladni mandat želi dokončati, a brez kompromisov ne bo šlo.



Marjan Šarec Foto: Leo Caharija

LJUBLJANA > Koordinator Levice Luka Mesec je opozoril, da bi koalicija s sprejemom dopolnil, ki jih je danes predlagala na spremembe zakona o zdravstvenem zavarovanju, povozila predlog Levice za ukinitev dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja. “Padla je še zadnja domina, ugotavljamo, da je vlada dokončno prekinila sodelovanje in odstopila od dogovora z nami,” je dejal Mesec.
Šarec pa je v izjavi ob robu odprtja pohištvenega sejma v Ljubljani že pred tem dejal, da je svoje, kar se tiče Levice, že povedal in da si sodelovanja ne želi prekiniti. Znova je obžaloval politiko ultimatov oziroma vsakokratnega zaostrovanja, saj ocenjuje, da se da v tišini in v nekem normalnem dialogu veliko narediti.
LMŠ kot sredinska stranka pripravljena na kompromise
“Je pa res, da bi od Levice tudi pričakoval nekaj več potrpežljivosti, kajti veliko projektov smo izvedli skupaj in tudi ti projekti, ki se že izvajajo, so tudi v sodelovanju z Levico. Niso pa vsi njihovi projekti izvedljivi na ta način, kot si oni zamišljajo,” je povedal.
Poudaril je, da je LMŠ kot sredinska stranka pripravljena na kompromise in jih tudi sprejemajo. “Politika je pač kompromis, zlasti v demokraciji in zlasti pri manjšinski vladi,” je dodal in spomnil, da ukinitve dopolnilnega zdravstvenega zavarovanja že pretekle večinske vlade z manj partnerji niso bile sposobne izpeljati. “Potem si ne smemo nič očitati, če tej manjšinski vladi to ne bo uspelo,” je dejal. Obenem pa je poudaril, da ne obupuje, in ponovil, da lahko zakonodajo sprejmejo le, če bodo vsi vložili napor v iskanje kompromisa. “Če tega kompromisa ne bo, pač ne.”
Glede nadaljnjega delovanja manjšinske vlade, ki ostaja brez formalizirane podpore Levice, je dejal, da morajo tako ali tako iskati podporo zunaj koalicije za vsak projekt oz. za vsak zakon, ki ga sprejemajo. Ob tem bi se mu zdelo nenavadno, da Levica ne bi tudi v prihodnje podprla vladnih zakonov, s katerimi se bo strinjala.
Proračunu bo podporo zagotovila SNS
“Tam, kjer se stranke strinjajo s predlogi vlade, tam pričakujem, da jih bodo tako ali tako podprle, če mislijo, da je to dobro za državo. Tako da v tem trenutku ne vidim potrebe po podpisovanju sporazumov,” je odgovoril premier na vprašanje o morebitnem podobnem povezovanju z NSi.
Proračunu bo potrebno podporo sicer zagotovila opozicijska SNS, a Šarec, kot pravi, ne bi rekel, da je vlada odvisna od glasov le te stranke, “odvisni smo od glasov vseh poslancev”.
Komentiral je tudi pobudo prvaka SD Dejana Židana o skupnem sestanku njegove stranke in Levice, da bi našli neko pot sodelovanja. Šarcu se zdi pobuda legitimna, ni pa prepričan, če bo uspela. “SD in Levica sta si nekoliko konkurenčni stranki, zato je Židan videl priložnost, da lahko doseže kompromis in da Levica še naprej sodeluje z vlado,” je dejal.
Šarec: ne vidim razloga, zakaj vlada ne bi delovala do konca
Na vprašanje, ali bo vlada kljub razhodu z Levico končala mandat, pa je Šarec dejal, da je to “tako, kot bi me vprašali, ali me bo jutri povozil avto”. “To je težko vedeti, sam imam načrt, da ta vlada deluje do konca, ker ne vidim razloga, zakaj ne bi. Vlada je izpeljala kar nekaj zakonov, kar se mene tiče, deluje, sam je zagotovo ne bom rušil. Ko bo sprejet proračun, res ne bo nobenega razloga, da bi vlado rušili,” je ocenil.
A dodal, da je to odvisno od tistih, ki “danes radi sklicujejo novinarske konference in ves čas majejo barko na tak ali drugačen način”. Ob tem se je spotaknil tudi ob dodatek za delovno aktivnost, katerega ukinitve ena izmed strank koalicije ni podprla. “In včasih je tudi na odborih vtis, kot da nismo v isti koaliciji. Potem je seveda težko kaj sprejeti,” je dodal.
Levica je ostro nasprotovala tudi ukinitvi dodatka za delovno aktivnost, sprejetje zakonske novele, ki je to uzakonila, pa je po vetu državnega sveta pod vprašajem. Šarec je veto pričakoval, kakšno bo glasovanje, pa ne more napovedati.

Šarec: The left wing government is not leaving, but vice versa
06 Nov 2019, 17:18 by STA

Prime Minister Marjan Sarec is convinced that it is not the government that is leaving the Left, but it may be the other way around. Even before Levica Coordinator Luka Mesec announced that they were no longer bound by the coalition agreement, Sarec reiterated in his statement that he wanted further cooperation. The government's mandate is set to end, but without compromise, it will not go away.



Marjan Sarec Photo: Leo Cahari

LJUBLJANA> Levica Coordinator Luka Mesec warned that by accepting the amendments proposed by the Health Insurance Act today, the coalition would overrule Levica's proposal to abolish supplementary health insurance. "The last domino has fallen, and we note that the government has finally discontinued cooperation and withdrew from the agreement with us," Moon said.
In a statement on the sidelines of the opening of the furniture fair in Ljubljana, Sarec had earlier said that he had already said his own, as far as Levica was concerned, and that he did not want to interrupt. He again regretted the policy of ultimatums, or the tightening of the case, since he said that much could be done in silence and in some normal dialogue.
LSG as a center party ready for compromise
“It is true that I would also expect some more patience from Levica, because many projects have been implemented together and these projects that are already underway are also in cooperation with Levica. But not all of their projects are as viable as they imagine, ”he said.
He emphasized that LMS as a central party is ready for compromise and accepts it. "Politics is a compromise, especially in a democracy and especially in a minority government," he added, recalling that the abolition of supplementary health insurance by the previous majority government with fewer partners was not able to deliver. "Then we should not blame ourselves if this minority government fails," he said. At the same time, he stressed that he did not give up, and reiterated that they could only pass legislation if everyone made an effort to find a compromise. "If there is no compromise, then no."
Regarding the continued operation of the minority government, which remains without formalized support from the Left, he said that they should seek support from outside the coalition anyway for each project or project. for every law they pass. At the same time, it would seem strange that the Left would not continue to endorse government laws with which it would agree.
The budget will be supported by the SNS
"Where parties agree with the government's proposals, I expect them to support them anyway if they think it is good for the country. So at the moment, I do not see the need to sign agreements, ”the Prime Minister replied when asked about a possible association with the NSi.
The budget will be provided with the necessary support by the opposition SNS, but Sarec, he says, would not say that the government depends on the votes of this party alone, "we are dependent on the votes of all deputies".
He also commented on the initiative of SD champion Dejan Židan to hold a joint meeting between his party and the Left to find some way of cooperation. The initiative seems legitimate to Sharq, but he is not sure if it will succeed. "SD and Levica are somewhat competing parties, so Židan saw an opportunity to reach a compromise and for Levica to continue to work with the government," he said.
Šarec: I see no reason why the government would not work until the end
Asked whether the government would end his term despite leaving the Left, Sarac said that this was "the way I would be asked if I would be hit by a car tomorrow". "It's hard to know, I have a plan for this government to work to the end, because I see no reason why not. The government has implemented quite a few laws, as far as I am concerned, it is working and I will certainly not break it myself. Once the budget is adopted, there really will be no reason to overthrow the government, ”he estimated.
But he added that it depends on those who "like to convene press conferences today and constantly barge in one way or another." He also stumbled upon a work allowance whose termination was not supported by one of the coalition parties. “And sometimes the committees have the impression that we are not in the same coalition. Then of course it's hard to accept anything, ”he added.
The Left has also strongly opposed the abolition of the employment allowance, and the adoption of a legislative amendment that enacted it is questioned by the veto of the National Council. Šarec did not expect the veto to expect what the vote would look like.
